I really enjoyed playing the old {{champion:114}}. Her unique set of abilities was really what got me into playing her. However, with the new {{champion:114}} I feel as though it is a **completely** _different_ champion. 

The change on her Q was fine. The dash is somewhat similar to the one before, and its provides more play potential as she can jump mini walls.

Her W on the other hand was a disappointment for me. It feels awkward using it and having all these defensive attributes put onto her W was really weird. I feel as though a simpler auto attack block was fine, especially for top lane. The slow/stun doesn't really fit her (at least in my opinion).

Her E is also fine. I like the new abilities that RIOT is implementing. It provides a little twist, which makes it a whole lot more interesting - rather than press E for an simple attack speed boost.

The new ultimate is basically what made me stop playing {{champion:114}}. I can see where the "pool of healing for team" idea comes from, but it is not very reliable in team fights and doesn't suit her ~~play style~~ new play style. I think she was fine with her old ultimate where she would "perform a waltz" and attack multiple targets, making her quite viable in team fights. With her new ultimate it focuses too much on single targeting, and although it may be trying to reference the "fencing one-on-one," the end result of a heal is really awkward. Also, hitting all 4 of the targets "weak spots" is **really hard**. Especially if they decide to lean on a wall. So even in 1v1 situations, its not really reliable. In a team fight, its also hard to use it on the right person at the right time. For example, getting it on the ADC is almost impossible unless you jump into their team, or the ADC is out of position. Their mid laner will back off, and basically any other smart champion will do so too.

Overall I think that Fiora _wasn't_ "fixed" or "improved" with the changes, but rather _mutated_ into a completely different champion with a different play style.
I feel as though her old hairstyle suited her more than the current one. The armour changes are fine, but her hairstyle really added to her personality.
